author: Staff Reporter
text:
Juvenile Justice Board chairperson and Judicial Magistrate No. VI K. Ambika ordered the District Child Protection Unit to provide education and job training to a 14-year-old boy who was caught for stealing a two-wheeler in 2014.

A case was registered by the Annathanapatti police who later arrested a 14-year-boy. He was produced before the Juvenile Justice Board and lodged at home. When the case came up for hearing before the board, the boy’s mother said that she had lost her husband and could not provide education to her son. The magistrate ordered the DCPU to arrange accommodation at child protection home and provide education and job training of the boy for three years.

The boy was later lodged at Don Bosco Anbu Illam.
title: DCPU asked to provide education for boy
